text: From tap at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Aroma is big dried fruits, sweet malt, oak, apricot, grandmas pie, stewed prunes, liquor, sugary notes, vanilla. Flavour is heavy sweet with warming booze. Body is full. Complex and rich, very impressive delicate stuff.

Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma is caramel, oak and a hint of bourbon. Taste is caramel sweet, fruity syrupy sweetness, oak, slight raisins, some sweet cherry characteristics, a little bit of boozy burn. Syrupy body.

Pours a cloudy reddish amber, vivid, suspended particulate, small head. Aroma is heavy in wood, cherry, fig, pepper, grape, alcohol. So smooth for the style, prunes, caramel, cherry, stone fruit, earth and wood. Lots going on. Nice manageable burn down the hatch. Very good!

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop

Black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is dried fruit, vanilla, fruity, and raisins Sweet dried fruitiness and a nice bitter finish. Medium body with very good carbonation.r

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop CPH.
Murky brown, minimal head.
Aroma: malty with dark fruit, sweet licorice, oak.
Taste: malty, vinous, oak, vanilla, toffee, dark and dried fruit, caramel.
Very tasty.

Bottle red amber color with a white head. Sweet cherry aroma. Sweet cherry chocolate flavor. Heavy body. The perfect alcohol and sweet happiness pleasure.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

21.03.2017, 12 oz bottle (2016 vintage) @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is dry concentrated fruity, minerals, oak, raisins, burnt caramel, alcohol, licorice, dried dark fruits, dark sugar, vanilla, toffee, caramel malts, fruit stones. Taste is sweet concentrated fruity, raisins, minerals, oak, grass, fruit stones, caramel malts, dark sugar, toffee, dried dark fruits, licorice, alcohol, burnt caramel. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice. Would love to cellar a few bottles of this for 10 years...

From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Unclear brown color with no head. Malty aroma, roasted, caramel, chocolate, toffee, vanilla, perfume notes, dark dried fruits, raisins, plums, wood, alcohol. Heavy sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Almost full silky oily body with soft carbonation.
Butelka, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Piękna wanilia, karmel, toffee. Super slodkie, wyklejące trochę na poziomie miodu pitnego. Znakomite.

12oz bottle from Bottlecraft San Diego. Pours a murky, muddy brown with a tan ring. Huge aroma with hints of sourness and strong, dark, sweet, malt. Massive flavor with syrup, light fruitiness and loads of dark malt. Just a hint of bitterness for balance. The finish almost reminds me of strong, sweet, black tea. This is a massive beer but it avoids being too much. Of course it better be good since it cost $26!

Bottle from Mikkeller Bottle Shop, Aarhus. Hazy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, fruity, wood and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Very sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 250217

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends bottle shop. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with cherry, resin, caramel, a bit of hops, toffee, peach and mango. Bitter finish with cherry, a bit of hops, mango, raisins, resin, a bit of alcohol and toffee. Exquisite barley wine.
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Murky orange. Vanilla, caramel, fruits, bourbon, sweet, chewy, rounded.
A: Hazy brown coloured, no head N: Almond, flowers, dandelion, honey, oak T: Dandelion, berries, honey O: Nice complexity, sweet, bitter and light tartness at the same time.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Melasa, figi, daktyle, figiiii. Cudowne.
Bottle at RBGT. Pours cloudy amber. Aroma is funky, leaves, hops, grass. Body is heavy, lots of oak barrel, with a lively carbonation. Warming palate. Wooden throughout, very nice.

Sample from 33 cl bottle. Hazy, amber colour with a thin, white head. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, vanilla, booze, bourbon barrel, ripe fruits, cheese and toasted notes. Taste is sweeet. Full body. Finishes sweet. Lovely beer.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with alazing beige head. The aroma has notes malt, straw, malt, and fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish.

Aroma and taste is sweet malty and dried fruity with some notes of caramel, toffee, lots of sultana, brown sugar, rich malty, gorgeous barley wine.
33 cl. Bottle. Dark amber colour with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, spice, yeast, vanilla, fruit, alcohol and sweeness.

12 fo oz bottle. Pours cloudy orange to brown with a small tan head. Aroma is overripe fruity and toasted malty. Sweet, caramelish and toasted malty. Sweet and toasted malty. Lingering dark malty and caramelish finish.

Thanks to Matt for this awesome brew! Ok, là je suis face à un Barley Wine qui me jette par terre. Jai beau avoir un penchant pour le style, là il faut savoir ouvrir les yeux et reconnaître que je suis ailleurs. Non pas que ce soit le meilleure Barley Wine qui soit, il est simplement franchement déroutant. Le fruit est titanesque dans cette bière à la robe rouge et sans mousse. Bon, au look cest loin dêtre attirant: aucune mousse pour camoufler les grumaux qui baignent en surface, robe boueuse à laspect stagnant. La cerise vole la vedette à la pêche. Un sucre céréalier important atténue les ardeurs de ces fruits déchaînés. Est-ce trop de fruits? Pas du tout. Texture sirupeuse et riche à souhait. Le liquide me coule lourdement dans la bouche en réchauffant mon oesophage de son alcool doux et boisé. Superior!

Bottle. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty woody caramel and dark fruit aroma with hints of vanilla. Fruity malty spicy woody vanilla caramel flavor with hints of dark fruit. Has a fruity malty woody vanilla caramel and dark fruit finish.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 355ml bottle - Overpriced Beer Tasting 2016 - thanks martjoobolut! (7:4:8:4:15=3.8)
Oh, this is a beautiful sipper. Sweet and malty, plenty of raisins. Even more raisins in the taste than the aroma. Full smooth palate, so mellow. Finish malty, raisiny, and woody. Damn, this is good.

Sweet malty aroma, some wood, some prunes. Flattish palate. Some mango in the taste, fruity, raisins. Good barley wine, but a bit sugary. Alcohol not well hidden, alas.

330ml bottle. Thanks, Mart! Dark amber colour. Very thin line of white froth on top. Sourness, toffee, berries in the aroma. Raisins, vanilla, lots of sweetness at first. Candy sugar, toffee in the middle. Caramel and liqeury notes in the end. Raisins and and some liqeury notes in the aftertaste. Rather heavy bodied, rather low carbonated, raisiny brew. Good and smooth one. Wuite sweet thow.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 355ml bottle (Overpriced Beer Tasting 2016, thanks Mart). Clear amber color. Small size, bubbly white head, stays. Sweet, raisins, plums, caramel in aroma. Sweet, raisins, caramel, woody, tannins and bit of baked apples in taste. Pleasant in mouth. Alcohol is kind of covered. Very solid brew.

Overpriced beer tasting 2016. 355ml bottle, shared by Mart, thanks! Hazy dark amber beer, no head. Nose is woody, malty, boozy, caramel, oak, raisins, bourbon. Flavor is bourbon, sweetness, raisins, caramel. Sweet and borderline sticky finish, more raisins and bourbon. Goes down easy, smooth mouthfeel. Hides the booze really well.
Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, malt, sweetness, caramel, booze. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, malt, fruits, raisins. Finish is sweet and malty. Overall: great.

355 ml bottle. 2016 vintage.
Pours dark clear mahogany color with a small head. Sweet vanilla aroma, maybe bourbon, caramel malts, toffee, ripe fruits, wood. Flavor is sweet syrup, caramel, toffee, some malty notes, ripe fruits, bourbon and vanilla tones, finishes with some berries. Excellent.
4427

330ml bottle from the brewery, vintage 2016. Pours dark reddish orange with a tiny head. Aroma of bourbon, wood, berries, caramely malts, toffee and oak. Taste is sweet, bourbony and oaky with some berries, vanilla, toffee, syrup and hints of cherries. Finish is heavy, sweetish and oaky with loads of bourbon, some caramely malts, toffee, vanilla and hints of cherries. Heavy and sweetish bourbon overdose.

355 ml bottle. Pours a dark ruby amber colour with a very small head. Aroma of really strong bourbon notes, dried peach, wood and some cherries. Flavour of heavy bourbon notes, really pleasant peach sweetness, dry wood, sharp tart cherries and caramel fudge. Full bodied. Warming, dry, sweet and juicy finish. Super.

35,5 cl bottle vintage 2016 @ Leppävaara. Thanks tiong!
Aroma has strong bourbon tones with vanilla and quite nothing else. Flavour has strong bourbon tones, some harsh malty tones and mild berry juice.

12oz bottle from share on 11/12. Pours out a hazy amber with a small ring of head. Aroma is stone fruit, booze barrel, very sweet. Taste follows with more of the fruit, some vanilla, and big boozy flavors. Plenty warm. Kind of sticky.

Tap. Slightly hazy amber body with a small off-white head. Aroma of peachy and cherry notes, brown sugar, caramel, vanilla, wood and spicy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry with bitter notes. Medium bodied. oily texture and soft carbonation. An excelent Barley.

Bottle 12fl.oz. [ As Hair of the Dog Otto from the Wood ].Clear medium amber color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, dried fruit, coconut, sweet malt, initial quit buzzy alcohol - but is clears up quick, light wood - oak. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long long duration, dried fruit - coconut, sugary, caramel, sweet malt, alcohol, bread - wood - oak. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to light moderate alcoholic. Nice ;) [20161018]

Bottle "2016", 13%. Hazy dark amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, dark fruit, cherry, wood, toasted, dark fruit and a little coconut. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, dark fruit, wood, oak, little coconut, warming, rich, notes of cherry, little sugar and notes of lacohol.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours slightly hazy dark golden with a small offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, little coconut, wood, oak, sweet dark fruit, alcohol. Flavor is rich malt, caramel, oak, little sweet spice, light coconut, dried fruit, heavy alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 181016
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Medium head with medium duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are wood, fruits, alcohol, caramel, malt and hops. Nice fruity finish.

6 October 2016, bottle. Murky brown. Nose is boozy, soft fruit, maybe some woody hints. Med body and mildly fizzy. Rather boozy, sweet, fruit juice, some woody tannins. Nice but hardly a beer. More of a boozy juice.
12 ounce bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a cloudy reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of fruit and malt. Taste is cherry, malt, caramel, peach, and barrel. Excellent.

Pours murky burgundy with no head. Aromas of raisins, muscovado sugar, oak, marinated fruit, caramel. Taste is quite sweet with oak character and marinated fruit. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with no carbonation.

Rating #4000. Yay! Pours murky brown with a light fizzy head that drops fast into a flat head. Aroma of dried fruit, raisins, bourbon, hazelnut, brown sugar, alcohol. Taste is rich sweet port with a mild nutty and boozy finish. Body is rich and smooth with a very special quality: a light carbonated fizz on first mouthfeel before mellowing out into a softer carbonation. Lingering alcohol warmth.

Pours murky rose hip brown with minimal head 
Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, dried fruits, alcohol
Taste has creamy notes of bourbon, oak, caramel, dried fruits, brown sugar, leather
Poured from 12 fl oz bottle [2016]. Amber brown with minimal beige head and a bit of sediment. Caramel malt and lots of stone fruit. Has a decent alcohol kick, but it is blended well. Dry-ish finish.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition. Bottle thanks to Aaron. Pours murky brown with a tiny head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, slight old hops, ripe fruits and pretty vinous. The taste has caramel, toffee, oaky barrel notes, ripe fruits and a warming alcohol end.

2016 12 oz bottle. Dark murky caramel color. Aroma of caramel malts, brown sugar, touch of vanilla and spirit. Some desert baking spices. Very sweet. Not getting the peach or cherry, the unique malts and barrel take over in this one.

Bottle thanks to Aaron. Pours dark brown/reddish with a small fizzy offwhite head and lots of chunks. Aromas of malts, barley, gummibears, clay, caramel, peach, oak, vanilla. Taste is malty, caramel, strawberries, vanilla, peaches.

12oz bottle pours a copper color with a little head. Delicious fruitiness over the Fred base. Subtle cherries and peaches that somehow deliver a fruit salad of fruitiness greater than the individual fruits. Nice carb balance.

Shared 2016 12 oz. bottle poured to a snifter displaying a clear, amber color, with a presentable layer of off white head foam, and spots of lacing. The nose was brown sugar sweetness, hint of vanilla, dried fruit, cherry skins, and peach. Medium bodied with decent carbonation, the taste was similar notes, added some tannic astringency, and booziness that didnt get in the way, Very nice!

2016 Bottle from Hair of the Dog taproom! Deep amber pour, almost no head. Nose is syrupy sweet reminiscent of Adam from the Wood an aroma that might live with me forever. The taste is rich sweet and full bodied. Tons of interesting peach and brandy notes! Yummy

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. Murky brownish pour with chunks of fruit in it. Notes of caramel, lingering tartness, vanilla, peaches and some sweet malts.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. This one thanks to Aaron. Pours a hazy, reddish amber with lots of bad chunks and a small, white head. Aroma has lots of caramel, vinous oak, canned peach, cherries. Taste is very sweet. Still lots of oak but not as acidic as expected. Very tasty actually! Sticky body and a fairly low carbonation.

Bottle pours mostly clear dark amber brown with minimal head. Big barrel aroma, sweet caramel and toffee, maple syrup, stone fruit, molasses, vanilla. Sweet caramel malt flavor, big and somewhat boozy. Peach and cherry notes. Medium-plus body, minimal carbonation. Good stuff. Different.

2016 vintage bottle drank at the brewery. Aroma is wood, cherries (pits and fruit), vanilla, toffee. Pours hazy amber with off-white foam. Taste is sweet, boozy, mild cherry and peach influence. Not bad. I know how good it will get with some age on it.

12oz bottle bought back at the 20th anniversary party. Hazy dark mahogany with a thin ring of beige head. A fruity and well balanced booze party with a dark almost burnt caramel malt presence that creates a very nice sweet aroma. Some peach schnapps, oak, dark vanilla, leather, light ash, cherry pits, some bourbon, becomes dry with a nice mild carbonation and full body that leaves a nice boozy and fruity finish leaving me at least wanting more.

Thank you GT2 for the bottle - Brown with an off white head - Sweet malt aroma with some fruity and woody notes - Good malt body with dark fruits, wood and vanilla with some caramel in there as well - The dark malts, caramel, fruits and wood goes into the finish - This was real good
2013 bottle - candied fruit, residual hop bitterness, booze, and wood are at the forefront. Soft carbonation makes it a little syrupy. Tastes pretty damn good though.

February 7, 2016 - bottle via trade. Brown pour with limited head and sediment. Aroma was bourbon, fruit, malt and spice. Taste was a nice blend of the flavors from the aroma. A great brew while watching the 85 Bears 30 for 30 special, best NFL team ever.

Bottle split on 3.29.14 with Adam and Chris. Thanks Adam.

Dark brown pour with tons of lingering head. Aroma is dark red fruits and lots of cherries. Taste is sweet with lots of malts. You can definitely taste the cherries and some of the peach. Pretty boozy.

Bottle at a share, 2013 vintage: pours a murky reddish brown color with off-white head. Wood tones, dark fruits, candied raisins, cherries, and some light peach tones on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium to full bodied. Finishes very sweet, like candied fruit.

KRS 101015. THX to Bergstaden. Red dark brown colour with a beige head. aroma is oxidation, dried fruits, alcohol, toffee, roasted malt, chocolate. Flavour is sweet, sugar, raisin, peaches, coffee, vanilla, oxidation, dried fruits, alcohol, toffee, roasted malt, chocolate. Full body. Very nice beer.
bottle, a sweet and sticky one here, lots of molasses and caramel layers. finish is sticky sweet, a vvery well made barleywine.

October 23, 2015. Bottle at home, vintage 2013. Received in a trade with heyta, thanks! 
Murky reddish brown with a small, quickly dissipating, off-white head, also some small chunks. Aroma is wood, caramel, bourbon, peach, raisin, sweet cherries and alcohol.
Taste is sweet malty and fruity. Finish is sweet peaches, caramel, hints of black berries, alcohol, hints of oak, cherries and alcohol. Medium to full bodied, creamy, oily texture and almost flat.

Bottle, vintage 2013. Shared by bergstaden. A murky reddish brown beer topped by a small beige head. The aroma has a lovely oxidation, dried fruits, some fresh fruits, peaches, alcohol boozyness, toffee-ish malts, a faint hint of spices and some dark chocolate. Its full-bodied, warming and smooth on the palate, with loads of flavors. Toffee, dark caramel, booze, wood and dried fruits. Some chocolate hints and nuts and cellar too. Some fruityness too, but in the back. Lasting boozy, caramel finish with fruityness and some notes of almond in the finish. Lovely indeed, very complex and tasteful. 151010

Bottle 355ml @ Geokkjer
[Courtesy of bergstaden] Pours hazy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of caramel, dried fruits, alcohol, wood and vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long warm, dried fruity, caramel, vanilla and woody finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft

Bottle, courtesy of bergstaden. Pours dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, cheese, hay,peach, some caramel and herbal hops. Flavor is sweet and malty with some fruitiness, caramel, peach, cherry, grains and mint. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle at Hair of the Dog, portland. Rich bourbon aroma with vanilla, peach, cherry and sweet Candi sugar. Pours reddish-caramel tint with no head whatsoever. Starts with sweet fruit notes of peach and cherry and lots of sweet Candi sugar. Finishes delightfully smooth with rich bourbon and vanilla and wood flavors. Awesome.
Rating #5000. Bottle. Brown pour with tan head and whats looks like fruit floating in it. Sweet malts, hints of cherry and peach, hides the alcohol really well.

Bottle shared with Luk. Clear red pour with tons of flaky yeast and fruit peel chunks, pretty gross really, you can feel the chunks sifting through your teeth when you drink, really not a clean bottle. Aroma is super rich bourbon laden malts, in true HotD fashion, decadent bourbon vanilla fruity notes, cherries, rich caramel malty notes. Taste is sweet but mellow, full of rich bourbon flavors, caramel, light fruity finish, light toasted notes, lots of oak. Palate is full bodied with good carbonation. Tasty.

(12oz bottle, 2013 vintage) Pours a murky brown body with a small off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, oak, bourbon, brown sugar, dried fruit, and caramel. Flavor of brandy, toffee, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, dates, plum, and cocoa.
From a bottle. Pours brown with a little beige head. Nose of bourbon, wood, and wine. Medium plus body. Rich mouth feel. Flavor is very rich with fruit bourbon and wood. Sweet finish. Excellent.

Bottle @ Hair of the Dog. Reddish pour with some fruit chunks and a short lived white head. Lots of whiskey, booze, and caramel. Some tangy peach and cherry pie. A really sweet smelling beer if nothing else. Some mild solvent. Big time maple, chocolate, and caramel. Sweet and tangy fruit. Lots of pie filling. Slight tang on the finish and plenty of whiskey. Interesting.
Bottle at the brewery. Pours a hazy brown with no head. The aroma is bourbon, wood, sherry. Medium mouth, rich malt, bourbon, cherry, really nice.
Bottle. Hazy Deep amber beer with an small offwhite head. Malty caramell chocolate fruity vinous aroma. Toffee, sourish, licorice caramell dark fruits flavour. Nice one :-)

Pour is dark murky brown with tons of sediment and a thin light brown head. Nose is rich malt, chocolate and dates with notes of alcohol. Taste is also very rich malt, not really sugary. Caramel, chocolate, brown sugar, notes of alcohol. Full bodied and soft carb with a creamy feel.

Bottle shared with me by 	AKfaust: Wow he poured this with a strainer and it was amazing to see all the chunks of fruit/unknown chunks that would have been in my glass. The actual glass was filled with murky brown meets burgundy, the head was white. Aroma is strong mixed fruits with vanilla. Taste is sweet aged peach and cherry fruit with bourbon vanilla clinging to it.

15/III/15 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ ElMananas 1st 9050 tasting - BB: n/a (2015-379) Thanks to ElManana for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy purple brown beer, no head. Aroma: bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, caramel, dried fruits, sugary. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sourish, lemony, fruity, peaches, dried fruits. Aftertaste: alcohol, dark chocolate, dried fruits, little sourish, very fruity, bourbon, vanilla.
Chunky beer with some cherry tones. Aroma is big on cherries, hints of bourbon and peach. Flavor is heavy on cherries as well.

12oz bottle pours out a muddy amber with a ring of a head. Nose is fruity some cherries peach barrel notes vanilla and lots of sweetness. Taste is more of the fruit mix peach cherries pit fruit sweetness vanilla some booze and a heavy syrup.

Vintage 2013. Thanks Kev! Je suis très surpris par la laideur affichée de cette bière. Dune couleur brune et rouge, elle très bouetteuse et ne montre aucune tête mousseuse. On dirait quelle connait aussi un départ bien pétillant. Le nez est très fruité, très anglais, très intéressant avec des notes boisées bien placées, des malts assez riches et une touche de vanille. Au goût, la cerise est puissante mais délicieusement équilibrée tandis que la pêche étonne par sa capacité dêtre précise. Cest vraiment bon ce truc! En bouche, le corps mapparaît comme étant moyen-fort avec une texture légèrement grasse et un pétillement déjà disparu. La finale me rappelle une liqueur fruitée qui nest pas si sucrée et qui développe une certaine chaleur. Hormis son look assez moche, je peux dire que ce vin dorge ma bien plu.

Une petite bouteille bue avec Patrick, merci. Une robe rouge avec du fizz, petite mousse peu durable. Des petits motons flotent, grumeaux. Un nez moisn pire que je pensais avec des fruits, du bois, whiskey, chocolat. Une bouche sucrée avec des saveurs de cerises, (ma blonde dit syrop Benylin qui a mal tourné).

Slightly hazy red brown colour, white head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, fruity, malts, dried apricot, honey, red fruits. Sweet flavour, bourbon, wood, candy sugar. Sweet finish, malts, candy, honey, dates, sticky dried fruits. (from 35cL bottle @ ElMananas first 9050 tasting. Thanks for sharing, ElManana!)

Bottle at ElManana's 1st 9050 tasting, thanks! Murky red-brown with no head. Explosion of bourbon, vanilla, some milk chocolate. Very sweet, some bourbon, dried dark fruits, but sugar dominates the whole thing. Too sweet for me personally.

The last remaining 12 oz bottle. I decided to strain out the chunks this time around. Poured into a snifter, the color is somewhat murky deep purple with ample (but short-lived) head that dissipates to a fine ring of bubbles. No lacing. Its remarkable how different this looks from Fred. Aroma: molasses and stone fruits condensed for hours into a jammy syrup. Taste: quite sweet; fruity, but the fruit isnt exactly at the forefront, despite being present throughout. Just a hint of appropriate tartness (think: fruit-tart, not "sour beer" tart). Palate: full body, average carbonation, sticky texture. Overall: this is a bottle that probably ought to be shared, given its intensity. Nonetheless, Im happy to enjoy this one all alone tonight. Another special creation from HotD.

Bottle 12 fl oz at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Year 2013 made. Colour is murky light brown with small white head. Also much sediment. Aromas and flavours: Dry fruits, cherries, sweetness and malts. Way too sweet and also sediment distracts little bit but overall very enjoyable and warm beer.

Purple beer with what looks like fruit skin. Others in the group didnt like the appearance of this beer but I thought it was an unusual change form what we typically see. Chocolate, oak, and vanilla. Some cherry flavor, not much of it, and the peach comes through as sort of an old peach juice flavor. Alcohol is there in the aroma and flavor. Dry yeast and oak finish.

2013 vintage, 355ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Thanks to douglas88. Pours muddy red brown, almost like port wine. No head and a few big floaties. Aroma is bourbon, malty, sweet, caramel and very fruity. Flavour is sweet. Medium bodied, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet, dark dried fruits, caramel and sour cherries.

Bottle (12 oz). 2013 vintage. From cparles, thanks! Split 2-ways with Minderbinder.

Appearance: Ugly muddy brown with no head and a light ring of beige foam. 

Aroma: Quite fruity, the peaches are noticeable at first followed by cherries. Its also quite boozy and theres caramel, vanilla notes and hints of cough syrup.

Taste: Quite sweet (both from the fruits and the malts) and boozy, with a lot of caramel, peaches, cherries, light vanilla and oak,

Palate: Full body. Soft carbonation (almost flat). Liquorous mouthfeel. Lingering sweetness and warming alcohol finish. 

Overall: Fairly complex sipper with rich malts, but cloying because of the fruits, the alcohol and the sweetness. Lack a bit of balance too.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours very hazy muddy reddish-brown. No head. Aroma is of lots of fruits, alcohol, bread, spices, oak, some slight oxydized rags. Cherries. Messy. Taste is of alcohol, nice fruits, bourbon, cherries. Quite sweet. Palate: Full bodied, very soft carbonation. Sweet/cloying. Overall: Alcohol not well hidden. Boozy. Would have been nice, but this one is just too much. Messy. Still enjoyable to some extent.

Bottle during (mostly) Hair of the Dog beers tasting. Many thanks again Jef!
APPEARANCE: clouded very dark blond beer, almost no head.
NOSE: alcohol, little fruity.
TASTE: alcohol, fruity, balanced, nice, little sour.
Unfortunately, there where some chunks in my beer (got a pour from the second half of the bottle). First half was perfectly fine. Rated from first half.

Bottle from a trade. Shared @ HotD tasting. Dark brown colour. Soft carbonation. Complex aroma of cherrys, peach, vanilla, oak, bourbon. Very well blend together. Sweet with a light fruity tartness. Wonderfull beer.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours murky and brown with big floaties and a fleeting, off-white head. The aroma is a luxuriant and sophisticated mélange of gooey caramel, dark raisins, toasted coconut and dark berries. Full-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor provides decadent, interwoven elements of caramel, brown sugar and tangy berries with loads of vanilla. Finishes malty, woodsy and fruity  caramel, berries, toasted oak and vanilla. Big thanks to landhoney for sharing this bottle of liquid happiness!

Pours an opaque ruby with almost no head. Aroma of boozy candied fruits and port wine...mild oakiness. Flavor follows suit...lots of dark fruit...cherry but Im not getting peach, rich malty sweetness, winey/oaky. Mouthfeel is medium / full and the finish is winey/earthy and warms with dark fruit.
Bottle from p.o.p.e. Very murky tan color. Aroma of fruit and Booz, lots of oak. Taste slight tart with peach being dominant. Lots of vanilla oak.

Pours murky amber with no head and big chunks of what give the impression of delicious peaches and cherries. Aroma brings the clean oak and some smooth vanilla, biscuit, and sweet malts. The flavor brings the peaches and even more cherries balanced with oak and sweet but the smoothest boozey notes that go down pleasantly on the palate. The chunks of sediment are delicious, fruit perhaps!

Drank at Borefts 2014 - a bottle shared by Thijs. Really nice beer, very pleasant taste. Great mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Fruity sweetness which I really liked. Complex taste, many different accents. Good beer! Sidenote: the bottle contained bits of fruit?? Really weird and slightly unpleasant.

1.5L bottle at BBF14, kindly shared by hannont - thank you sir for the kind gesture. Pours brown amberish - as murky as can be, pieces of peach and cherry flesh floating around. Most disgusting look ever. Yet... the aroma is really rich: peach and apricot marmelade, plulms, roasted and caramel malt. Medium to full bodied with a rich fruity dose of flavours, little bit of the alcohol.

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours reddish brown with some fruit chunks and a small head. Aroma of cherries, bourbon and oak and vanilla, toffee and caramel and nutty and light chocolate malts, more dark fruits, and some light bitterness. Flavor the same with an incredible blend. Smoother texture. A really cool and unique beer.

Bottle at the brewery December 2013. Dark mahogany color, no head. Hints of cherries inside peaches dipped in bourbon on the nose. Flavors have touches of wood, cherry, peaches, thick malts, a hint of alcohol, toffee with apples, and candy. Thick, powerful, savory, and amazing. More please!!

Brown bottle, 12 ounces, 21013 vintage, gift from Alan Sprints while visiting in January 2014, savoured on September 15 2014; eye: mahogany with a burgundy hue, semi-hazy, suspended matter, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; mouth: bourbon, woody, rich, cherry, alcohol warmth, toffee, peach, finale in bourbon with presence of alcohol, full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 12 onces, 13 %, millésime 2013, cadeau de Alan Sprints lors dune visite en janvier 2014, savourée le 15 septembre 2014; il : acajou avec une teinte bourgogne, semi-voilée, matière en suspension, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : bourbon, boisé, fruité, cerise, alcool, toffee; bouche : bourbon, boisé, riche, fruité, cerise, alcool, chaleur dalcool, toffee, pêche, finale en bourbon avec présence dalcool, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, riche, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien bon

From trade. Sorry dont remember who. Pours a dark mahogany, with some slight floaties, poured vigoriously with a slight off white head. Smell is biscuity, bourbon, booze, vanilla, oak, ripe dark fruits, aged cherries. Taste shows the cherries more, smooth bourbon, vanilla, oak, some booze.

355 ml bottle. Pours a very murky pruneish red with a short lived white head. Aroma is bourbon, liquor, wood, cherry and peach. Flavor is lots of fruit, cherry flesh, peach, wood, bourbon, fruit pur. Finish is wood, bourbon. Lingering wood, liquor, cherry. Very thick body, soft mouthfeel, null carbonation. Solid.

Deep amber color with big chunks that poured out from the bottom of the bottle. Thin beige head. Boozy fruit nose. Delightful peach flavor with cherry and berry notes and a great bourbon barrel addition. Very tasty beer.

HOTD definitely over barrels their beers. There, I said it. With the exception of Adam from the Wood, theyve all been overly boozy. That said, theyve all been very good...you just have to know what youre in for. Strong boozy aroma and feel, sweet flavor. Otto is bourbon Fred with peaches and cherries. A nice addition, especially the cherries. Softens things up a bit, and adds another level of complexity. The peaches are more subtle and really just noticed in the aftertaste. Good brew."

Appearance: Pours dark amber with a ring of white.

Aroma: Sweet cherry,maple/brown sugar, bourbon.


Taste: Toasted malt, chocolate, cherries, bourbon, mild hop spice.

Mouthfeel: Warming. Chunks of fruit. Full.

Overall: Such a treat. I like this far better than the base beer itself. The fruit and oak treatment made this beer majestic.
Murky reddish brown. Coconut, vanilla, burnt sugar, booze soaked pie cherries, peach pit. Buttery/oaky mouthfeel, mild heat, soft carbo. Stupid good

2013
Medium brown with an off-white head.
Complex aroma.
Sweet, fruity, with a bit of tartness in the finish.

Multiple bottles of this going around @ Woodshed 3.0. Dark crimson, garnet, and mahogany pour with a small khaki head. Toffee, roasted coffee bitterness, salted caramels, bourbon, butterscotch, molasses, and brownie batter. Alcohol is is lightly noticeable but not distracting. Not getting the cherry or peach but damn delicious!

Bottle 12 fl oz at Fruits of the Foeder, 2014-05-17.Marked 2013.Murky brown color with pieces of fruit, small white head. Sweet, malty, alcohol, sugary scent, very Barley Wineish. Sweet, malty, sugary, aged, raisins, alcohol taste. Warming alcohol. Barle Wine sweet aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, but with disturbing pieces of fruit in it. Medium bitterness. Almond taste as well, more to almond oil than almond paste.

A- pours a murky rusty red with a light pink head that does not linger. No lacing. S- fruit leather, cherry cordial, vanilla, brown sugar, caramel malts, vinous, toffee, musty oak, grains. M- oily medium to full body with a sweet and sugary palate with some light tartness and high heat on the back end. Very mild carbonation. T- sour cherries, toffee and vanilla up front. Mid palate is grains, red grape tannins, butter croissant and coconut. Ending is long and aggressive with banana, dates, raisins, dough and bitter grass. Some minerals.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you GT2! Pours murky reddish brown with a small pinkish offwhite head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with caramel, toffee, charred wood, vanilla fudge, shredded coconut, sour cherries, bourbon and leather. Taste is sweet, malty and tiny fruity with toffee, caramel, Bassetts liquorice allsorts, raisins, dates, caramelized almonds, coconut shavings, vanilla fudge, charred wood, leather, hay and brazilnuts. Mouthfeel is round, soft, tiny sticky sweet,very tiny fruity tart and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and malty with caramel, toffee, liquorice fudge, vanilla fudge, charred wood, sour cherries, hay and leather. Interesting and as usual, very tasty.
Pours hazy redish amber with small head and lumps of fruit. Aroma is barleywine sweet raisins peaches. Flavor is malty sweet boozy astringent some fruitiness nicely bitter raisins.

Fruits of the foeder @ Alex
Murky, dark amber. Almost no head. 
Vinous, sweet, wooden, fruity. 
Thick, slightly oily palate. 
Very fruity and vinous flavour along with tid-bits/liquorice all-sorts.

Bottle at Fruit of the Foeder, 2014-05-17. Cloudy deep orange/amber beer with a very small head. Malty vinous aroma, toffee, caramel, grapes, chocolate, peach notes, figs, some prunes. Toffee flavor, sourish, licorice, Caramel, warming alcohol, figs, dades, english licorice, banana notes. Nice beer.

12 oz. bottle shared at the RBWG Friday night bottle share at the Downtown Inn. Pours a hazy amber color with a thin off white head. The aroma and flavor have caramel, brown sugar, peach, dates, raisins, black cherries, and oak. Medium-bodied, with light carbonation and a sticky sweet feel. I enjoyed this.

#400 USA beer. #40 HotD. 33 cl. bottle obtained in a trade with AdamJackson. Thanks. Shared with Kraddel. Pours a very dark ruby brown, there are some bubbles on top but not much in the way of head. Nose is rich with bourbon and the good kind of oxidation that makes me instantly think of HotD, very thick syrupy with rich brown sugar, very warming with thick alcohol soaked cherry, lots of sugar, syrup, light walnut oxidation, this is why we tolerate flat and lesser HotD bottles because he frequently puts out beer this freaking good. Taste is thick alcoholic cherry mixed with syrup de Liège with lots of molasses, brown sugar, warming bourbon, wood, ridiculous goodness, very warming and boozy, I can feel the peaches in the back mixed with alcohol only because I know that they are there, I doubt that I would find them if I didnt know that they were there, tasting more cuberdons, vanilla, alcoholic brambleberries etc. Lower carbonation but that fits the beer perfectly. This is almost to much take in when drinking half of a bottle, ridiculous. This is why some people worship HotD.

Thnx to 77ships 
Pours dark murkey brown 
Almost no foam 
Smells intense , sweet , fruity , oak 
Low carbo 
Very full , oaky , vanilla taste . Very intense , thick body 
. Touch of cherries , dont get too much peaches tbh . Very nice one yet again from a brewery im growing a big intrest in !

12 oz bottle. I love these guys; a fitting #3200 for me. Muddy brown with brief foam leaving a few specks. Up front wood and musty caramel greet the nose. Magically the peach and cherry begin to emerge. Sharp and tangy, slightly sticky, so lively on the palate, wonderfully lightening the high ABV. Taste is a seamless melding of the fruit and caramel. Tart, woody and earthy then sweet and jammy, the peach adding a sour note. Finishing dry and leathery. Very cool.

Stealth bottle slipped to me due to my behemoth status in the beer community. Pours turbid dark brown with tan head. Nose is oaky bourbon, cherry and peachy fruit, vanilla, cherry, fig, raisins, brown sugar. The nose here is awesome. Tastes intense malty oaky bourbon, brown sugar, earthy figgy fruitm cherry, berry, and a complex, intense, amazing finish. Go to the ends of the earth for this,

Pours dark mahogany with a highly carbonated head that disappears quickly. Aroma is peach skin, cocktail cherries, and oak. The taste is ripe peach up front with vanilla and barrel notes followed by a light cherry tartness. Complex and tasty.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark amber/brown with a transient beige head. Aroma of cherry and wood followed by a waft of peach. Med body. Flavor is tobacco/wood followed by cherry, followed by peach. The wood moves from oak to cherry pits. Extremely tasty.

Bottle from haggerty. Pours orange brown with a transient beige head and a treacle and peach aroma. There is a full-bodied dark molasses and fruit flavor with a lovely alcohol trail. Complex and tasty.

2013 poured from bottle to glass. Turbid reddish brown hue with fruit particles suspended and fizzy off white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is peaches, pie cherries, honey, sweet malt, wood, minerals, caramel, slight banana. Mouthfeel is fantastic with medium body and nice carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness initially with fruit acidic following and a nice balanced ethanol and malt finish. Overall, this is an absolutely fantastic brew but it is a bit chunky with fruit particles. Some may be turned off but I love the rustic qualities of this fine brew.

Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Murky, ruby-tinted brown body with some chunks of sediment & a mildly soapy, gray collar. Aroma has notes of dark & warm sherry alcohol, sweet cherry juice, bourbon soaked wood, prunes, toffee, & that signature peaty leather note I get from most Hair of the Dog old style ales. Not getting much peach, really. Taste follows through with big cherry up front, booze-laden with an underlying sweetness. Just a very small hint of peach, though Id never pick that out without being told... very subtle. Notes of smooth caramel, sticky toffee, wet oak, & faintly tart cherry on the back-end, leading to a boozy, bourbon filled aftertaste & mouth coating. Nice, heavy-ish body on this one. Another really nice ale from the guys out west, though not quite on the same level as things like Adam or Matt.

At big Seths going away party on 11/2/2013; was an awesome day! Aroma is plumb, hay, dirt, tartness, light acidity. Taste is dark raisin, chocolate cherry, light roasted malt, silky, smooth, delicious.

12 oz. bottle. 2013 vintage. Dirty, dark brown color. Aroma of berries, earthy malt and large amount of deep oak. Off the wall wood. 
Flavor is deep layers of oak and malt mixed with hints of fruit. Tangy berries, burnt molasses, tart peach hints and thick mouthfeel. Almost a cognac undertone. Light tobacco hints, pretty complex flavors.
The fruity peach and berry is balanced well with the oak. Nice depth of flavor and character.

Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle: The aroma consists of caramel, cherries, cola, and a hint of peaches (probably wouldnt notice if it didnt say so on the label). It pours brownish-orange with a small beige head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with toffee, caramel, and brown sugar. The finish has cherries, faint vanilla, maple syrup, and almost no peaches (I think theyre there because the label says so). Its medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat sticky mouthfeel.

Picked this up in Portland OR

A - Weird chunks of peaches. Gorgeous dark brown to black pour. 3 finger head, bottle didnt gush but it certainly foamed a lot

S - Huge raisin, figs and currants nose. Cherries are certainly dominant but lots of dark tree fruits and caramel. 

T - Sweet, candy like. The cherry comes through in a huge way. Super malty, refined for a huge 13% ABV. Oak presence is dominating. candy like intensity

M - Boozy finish, slick, sweet and oily

O - This is not as good as I expected it to be but very nice. If only it was a little less hot

Bottle share in 2013. Dark mahogany with a small khaki head. Nose is a bunch of dark fruits, brown sugar, earth, and sour mash. Flavor has a bit more malt presence - dark caramel, molasses, plums, dried fruit, light booze, oak. Finish is warming alcohol.

Tasted on 2/7/14 from a capped 12oz bottle at the Friday night tasting at RBWG Asheville. Pours chunky dark red/amber with a thin beige head that slowly disappears. The nose is fruity sweet barley wine, plenty of ripe peach, cherry, and some coconut and vanilla oak. The flavor is the same, very complex sweet barley wine with all of the added peach and cherry, and the vanilla, coconut, and cinnamon oak melding nicely. The body is very full with average carbonation and a long, oaky, fruity finish.

Bottle, courtesy GT2, thanks! Pours dark amber, small tan head. Little retention, big legs. Aroma of barrel, cherry, fruit. Taste is sweet, lightly tart, big cherry, barrel, vanilla. Palate is soft, oily, sweet finish. Very decadent.

Bottle to snifter (shared by tastybeer; thanks!). Looks good (and its carbonated!); a translucent amberish brown with off-white lacing. Smells and tastes sweet and malty with notes of peaches, cherries, and oak. Pleasant on the palate. A nice, refreshing example of the style that is dangerously drinkable.

Bottle courtesy of Thom, shared with Pat, Dallas and Sean. Pours a deep murky brown with no head. Aroma is super rich vanilla, bourbon, earthy wood and caramel candy. Mouthfeel is medium to full and rich with notes of decadent desert - vanilla, chocolate cake, bourbon, syrup, molasses, maple and caramel. Very nice.

Bottle care of Thom. Split with James and Sean and Thom. Pours chestnut with no head. Aroma of caramel, maple syrup, brown sugar, molasses, and dark cherry. Taste is insanely sweet caramel, coconut, peaches, and cherry. Pretty excellent in small doses.
Bottle with Pat, James, and Sean Tommy. Pours brown with almost no head or lace. Nose toffee, bourbon, oxidized hops. Sweet and syrupy, big bourbon taste. Hot and warming.

Bottle shared at RBWG GT. Poured a muddy brown with an average sized light foamy beige head with some tight small bubbly carbonation. Aroma is the best thing about this beer. Notes of sweet caramel, toffee, bourbon, wood. The body is sticky with a medium mouthfeel and light carbonation. Flavor is a big drop off for me. Notes of vegetable soup, sweet rotting raisins, dough. This one just doesnt do it for me, gotta go agasinst the grain on this one.

Merci à mcberko pour la bouteille! Je suis assommé par la potabilité des arôme à louverture de la bouteille, mélasse, sucre à la crème, cerises, chocolat enrobé déthanol chaud. Le corps rappel celui de la Adam, liquoreux presque gras mais une bonne effervescence au début. Une cascade de cherry blossom avec une pointe dacidité de pêche prépare une finition boisée croustillante mais hyper sucrée, une fine membrane résineuse se fait sentir aussi. La complexité ralentit la buvabilité...parce quon veut pas que ça finisse.
12oz, expensive ass bottle. Poured a reddish/brown color with an off white head. Chewy/juicy fruity floaters. Wood, cherry, vanilla, some earthiness, peaches, and caramel.

This one poured a ruby red color with lots of cherry skin floatis hanging out. Aroma was really big, lots of dark fruits, skins, brown sugar, lots of barrel toasted oak, sweet caramel. Flavor was lots of dark fruits, lots of barrel, toasted caramel, some chocolate. Tons of flavor, not heat, very integrated.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks bro! pours dirty dark copper with a minimal light orange head, minimal lacing and chunky pulpiness. peppery candied dark fruits - very fruity - miscellaneous red fruits although cherries prevail, brown sugar, nutty caramel, strong woodsy notes, bourbon, but maybe more port than bourbon, red grapes, spices, chalk, grass. low carbonation, medium body - oily, moderate sweetness, boozy and grassy-spicy-tannic finish. nice but nothing outstanding.

Pours a dark murky brown and is filled with chunks that appear to be fruit residues. It is topped by a small white rim that dont leave much lacing. Nose is of bourbon and caramel with some really light kirsch notes. Taste is sweet and bourbon-forward with fruity and brown sugar flavors. Mouthfeel is sticky, carbonation low. It is thick/syrupy and surprisingly not too hot for such a big beer. Nice one, glad we shared it though!

12 oz. bottle shared at the RBWG Friday night bottle/fart share at Downedtown Inne. Pours a hazy amber with some floaters and no head. Notes of caramel, brown sugar, dates, raisins, dried cherries, peach, and oak. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. Pretty good, but a bit of a disappointment based on other offerings.

12 oz. Nearly opaque reddish-brown with a small spit of foam and a few fruit chunk floaties. Aroma is dark fruits - plums, cherries, prunes - poached in brown sugar, earthy spices and whiskey. Tastes of cherry, prunes, toffee and whiskey with hints of peach and oak. Medium-heavy body is sweet, but the finish of oak provides a decent balance. A little warm with the 13%, but not overly so. Low-medium carbonation is smooth.

Bottle thanks to Bruce at RBWG 2014, thanks! Pours a cloudy light amber with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma if full of sweet grains and caramel with a with a bit of light peach and sweet cherry underlying. Flavor has more light peach up front with sweet grains and a bit of caramel as well.

Bottle @ The HUGE Tasting. Thanks to Bruce for the pour. The appearance is brown with a small tight head. The aromas of strong rich toffee. Chocolate and chocolate ice cream. The taste is bright and fruity. A touch of tart cherry skin, roasted red apple. Some cocoa, toffee, chocolate cake. Somewhat spicy. Lovely balance. Full body, soft carbonation. Overall, fantastic. A great beer to pair against Great.
Bottle at RBWG Downtown Inn tasting. Pours amber brown with off white head. Nose and taste of toffee, dark fruitcake, bourbon, oak, vanilla and caramel. Full bodied.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #49. Bottle shared at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a hazy dark amber color with a medium sized foamy tan head. Aroma of toffee, spice, dark fruit, chocolate, wood. The taste is toffee, raisin, dark fruit, mild wood. Medium bodied.

Aroma: Vanilla, Oak, Brown Sugar, Plums, Mild Cherry

Appearance: Reddish/Brown Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head, Some Lacing

Taste: Vanilla, Oak, Bourbon, Peaches, Mild Cherry, Mildly Boozy

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Boozy

Bottle shared at RBWG grand tasting! Pours a hazy copper brown with little to no head or lace. Aroma is big on the barrel with vanilla and butterscotch. Taste follows, sweet and woody with hints of molasses. A little sweet but not too boozy, very light carbonation.

Bottle from HOTD brew pub in Portland. Pours a cherry brown combo...almost no head. Oaky / boozy nose and sweetness mixes in with the initial tastes. Definitely a slow sipper...savor it. Tasty.

---Rated via iPhone

Bottle shared during some post-bus drinking at the Downtown Inn for RBWG. Nose flairs the nostrils with bourbon smoke and gooey butterscotch. Luscious bourbon and butterscotch candies flavor with some nice peach tartness to round it out. Excellent!

Bottle @ RBWG Fart Share. Pours a murky orange brown appearance with a thin head. Some cardboard, caramel, fairly boozy, leather aroma. Slightly tart fruity / cherry, caramel, ride flavor with some oxidation. OK.
Black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is dried fruit, vanilla, fruity, and resiny hops, Sweet dried fruitiness and a nice bitter finish. Medium body with very good carbonation. A very nice beer
Poured from $15 12 oz bottle. Excellent barley wine. Great opaque sierra brown. Light white sudsy head around rim. Some brandy barrel notes, cherry. Some syrup per style but smooth.
UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 Absolutely amazing, thank you GT2, dark pour, off white head, lots of cherries and so sweet, amazing brew, perfect barleywine

36cl, Vintage 2013, new exclusive American brew, with cherries and peaches, thx alot to John for the bonus!, very complex sweet brew, alcoholic/fruity and slightly woody, heavy, yet balanced, cloudy, small head, very good and original brew!

Bottle. Thanks so much Jack for sharing this treat. Well Alan never stops making awesome beer unlike any others in the world. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked the bits of fruit floating around in this beer as I consumed it. The fruit works very nicely to taper off some of the big malty sweetness from regular Fred. Would love to spend some more time with Otto.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2014 Bottle 2013 on the front label. Pour has a dirty brown color with some bits floating about even on the early pour. Aroma has nice barrel aging, vanilla, a richly malted core, mild cherry, and some heat. Mouth feel is leaning towards the heavy side with big coating and light carbonation. Flavor is very complex with lots of layers. The barrel aging shines with vanilla and light bourbon bringing the malt side together well while softening the edges all around. I wish the fruit added more than it does because there is dark fruit but the cherry itself is not a standout and I found very light touches of peach that I think added sweetness and mouth feel more than anything. The bottom half of the bottle had big chunks that are fleshy peach bits some that had to be fished out of the glass. Excellent barley wine that has classic Hair of the Dog all over it!

3rd January 2014Mega Tasting at Bruces pad. Big thanks to our Brucey boy for this lovely little thing. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is light and crispy. Nice smooth caramel malt with a touch of spicy chocolate. Sweet coconut and a touch of vanilla. Light bourbon. Various fruits. Light semi dry finish. Very well joined up and tasty.

Bottle. Pours mahogany in color, very cloudy, with a small fizzy head that fades to a ring. Strong aroma of cherries and coconut with some wood, toffee, vanilla, and dark fruit. Taste is a bit sweet but still pretty good. Cherry syrup, toffee, caramel candy, vanilla, coconut. Finishes with a touch of booze and tobacco to go with the big cherry taste. Sweetness seems to calm a little after warming, becomes more boozy, but still easy to sip on. Mouthfeel is syrupy and pretty thick. This was an interesting fruity barleywine, definitely a sipper. Good beer but not in the same category as some of the HOTD Ive had.

Bottle thanks to the man with the Crazy flatmate, shared at that massive Friday tasting. It pours cloudy brown with a small beige head. The nose is sweet coconut, wood, cherry, stewed dark fruits, vanilla and candy. The taste is toffee, brown sugar, candy, tangy cherry, raspberry, jamminess, plum and fruit cake with a sweet finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Hides abv pretty well actually. Another sweet mother of a barley wine straight after 3 others. Almost slipped into a coma.....

Bottle from HOTD. Based on their track record and the description of what is in here, Im approaching this one with more interest and enthusiasm than 99% of the beers I get to try. In short, my expectations are met but not exceeded. 

Pours into my Gulden Draak tulip in a hazy brown with russet highlights and a short-lived brown head. Huge aroma, trademark HOTD, dominated by boozy, bourbony oak and backed by brown sugar and peaches, the slightest hint of cheese. Cherries come on as the beer warms to room temperature. Flavor of dark caramel and raisins and dates, vanilla from the wood, and faint hints of peach, more wood and mouth-drying cherry skins late. The 13% is fairly apparent in the mouthfeel though not dominant in the flavor, lots of warmth on the mouth and especially in the throat. Ill be very interested to see how this one ages and Im glad to have three more bottles in the cellar.

Bottle shared at the Big Friday Brokeback Tasting, big thanks to our host with the most - Bruce and another OR tick 03/01/14.
Dark mahogony brown with thinnish off white headwork that dissipates to a pond in time.
Nose is dark toffee fudge, dark fruits, dates, stewed prunes, light cocoa, woody ring, earthy, a little dirt, faint tobacco.
Taste comprises dark toffee, muscavado sugars, touch of alcohol, earthy, dark fruits, berry fruits, sweet, light booze soaked wood, dates, fruit loaf.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, fair boozey buzz in the closure.
Solid barley wine, booze evident but I thought the 13% was well tempered and integrated.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 Bottle at the big tasting. Cheers to Bruce again for these Hair of the Dog beers. Pours clear chestnut brown with a small khaki head. Nose is plenty of dark fruits and peachy plums with brown sugar and a slightly stewed note. Taste is plum and peach forward with brown sugar, raisin, cherry, sticky sweet toffee and creme caramel. Booze is there in warmth. Solid

Bottle shared at the Brokeback Revisited tasting in London. Many thanks to Bruce for it. Pours mostly clear amber with a slight, creamy beige head. Dried berries in the nose, earth, toasted brown sugar, tangy berries. Medium sweet flavor with further tangy berries, brown sugar, lightly toasted bread. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lots of tangy berries to finish, more brown sugar, fruitcake, figs. Solid beer.
2013 release. Opened 12/28/13. Pours a beautiful amber. Big and boozy. A distinct alcohol note, balanced by bourbon, and some peach and apple notes. Maybe a slight tart cherry note.

Bottle shared with Al and chevonne, pours purple brown with light head, no lacing. Aromas and flavor a little on the boozey side but it is young. Notes of peat, strong whiskey, plums, cherry wine, and spicy wood. Light to medium body. Good bit of burn. Alright, could use aging but not sure how much better it would get.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2014 2013 bottle at the brewery. Had this twice now, what a difference. No floatiess.  Clear copper pour with an off white head.  Inciting barrel aromas. Sweet and tasty with big cherry, peach, and caramel malt notes. Vanilla and oak undercurrents. Outstanding mouthfeel with a god body.

12oz bottle from a trade. Pours deep red, floaties, minimal head, good lacing Smell big toffee, light vanilla oak. Taste sweet oaky whisky, cherry, bit of a bitterness, bit of heat, caramel, rye sweetness and a bit of candy on finish Medium to full body. Good beer!

Bottle thanks to Chris out in the PNW. Dark purple pour, slightly brownish. Almost no head. Lots of fruit chunks in this one - wonder how that will influence it over time. Nose is dark fruit and oak. Taste is really unique, in a good way. Really pleasant aftertaste on this one.

2013 vintage. 
Aroma is fairly fruity with a lot of plum, prune, cherry and raisin. Reminds me of a brandy or fruit liqueur. Light smokiness and chocolate with moderate caramel and toffee. Medium oak note with light vanilla. 
Pours a slightly cloudy burnt amber to brown with ruby highlights. Non existent head with no lacing. Not so much legs as sheets of alcohol. 
Flavor is also very fruity with a lot of peach character that the aroma didnt really have. Medium cherry notes with some plum and prune as well. Faint smokiness with light chocolate, moderate caramel and toffee. Some burnt sugar. Medium high bitterness and medium oak notes. Some alcohol spice in the finish. Lingering oak nots, dark fruit and alcohol. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with almost zero carbonation. Low astringency and medium alcohol warmth.
Overall an alright beer but some carbonation would really help. At first I didnt realize this was a fruit beer and was surprised by all the fruit notes. The oak character is also stronger than expected. I think I like regular Fred better.

Thanks to someone for sharing this bottle. Brown pour with a white head. The aroma is awesome with a lot of whiskey, oak and hot alcohol notes. The flavor is also very good. I get some great peach and chocolate-covered cherry notes as well as some alcohol and whiskey notes. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. An awesome beer and I am happy I have another coming to me from my man Andre in the PNW.

12oz bottle courtesy of a sweet trade with GT2. It pours out as a dark liquid and right from the start plenty of chunks of some sort of dark debris also empty out. Interesting. In the glass the body is murky mahogany in color and supporting a tiny white like set of bubbles. The aroma is big and full and rich with brown sugar coated ripe cherries, vanilla and molasses. It gets into smooth sweet bourbon and chocolate covered oak toward the end of the draw. The taste begins smooth as sweet cherries mingle with molasses and sweet dark fruity esters that have a boozy edge to them. Then smooth sweet bourbon, sweet vanilla and a bit more booze show up about midway. I get some thick malts and chocolate joining in also before sweet prune and cherry fruitiness help take this to the finish. Dandy sipper.

Magnificent. Privileged to enjoy from bottle at HOTD on 11/2213. Think of a higher carbonated cherry Adam ftw with subtle peaches. This is my new favorite beer, and I?m an IRS lover. Fruity floaties seemed to have settled down, at least in my bottle.
Bottle at HOTD. Dark brown pour, light tan head. Chunks of fruit and stuff, but I am ok with that! Peach, cherry, oak, vanilla, dark toffee, thick and awesome. Love this stuff.

Pours murky mahogany.

Smell fruity, peach and cherry, bit belgian

Taste fruit bouquet, sweet, no heat. Oaky vanilla.

Mid body

Decent. I like it better than Cherry or Peach Fred by themselves.
12 ounce thanks to Prufrockstar. Cherry red. Wine and peach. And there are floaties of fruit in this beer! Oak in the nose and a touch of bourbon to finish. Almost sangria like. Absolutely fantastic.

12oz to snifter. Dark brown with hints of red. Sweet vanilla and oak aroma and some booze. Huge sweetness and cherry tartness. Barrel flavor comes out by the degree it warms. Chunks of fruit floaters. Amazing.

12oz bottle, 2013 vintage, thanks Michael!. Pours a murky, reddish brown color with a thin tan head that fades away to nothing. And bits of fruit floating in it. Aroma is fruity, cherry, oak, a little boozy. Medium on the palate with sharp, but somewhat creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, oak, some nice alcohol heat, fruit, cherry, maybe a little peach, some tobacco, maybe a little vanilla, with a sweet, fruity finish. Very nice, but I could see this getting better with age as some of the alcohol heat fades.

(12oz bottle thanks to brystmar) deep ruby brown, white bubbles. Nose is very rich, cherry, cream, oats, bourbon, caramel, complex as anything, alcohol, smells amazing. Taste of cherry, vanilla, alcohol, delicious and complex, caramel, very sweet, nice beer.
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Gusher, half the bottle lost. Small, cloudy, caramel colored pour. Caramel, boozy, oaky, maple syrup aroma. Chunky, cherry, syrupy,Carmel, and alcohol in the flavor.
Bottle. Gushed all over the counter. Like a volcano. Nose is fruity. Chunks are found on inspection. Slightly medicinal and phenolic. Not grate considering the effort and price.
Pours ruby red with a thin white head. Smells of residual sugar, oaky, boozy, dark fruit. Tastes of raisins, cognac, vanilla, some cherry notes. Enjoyable.
Tap taster at brewery. 2013. Deep cloudy burnt amber. Great aroma of more excellent shit. Dark fruit, candy, etc of pant jizzery goodness.

Served at the Hair of the Dog anniversary party. Dark brown with a small pale head. Aroma is raisins, balsamic vinegar, dates. Full bodied, sweet on the palate.  Taste is raisins, soy sauce, dates, brown sugar, peach, hint of anise. Tasty

Very fizzy at first, but settles quickly to basically no head. Brown with a red tint. Smell is of nutty oak, bourbon, sweet alcohol. The taste is sweet, oaky, tart, fruity, slightly of alcohol. Delicious! A lot of flavors and none of them over powering or off putting with the others.
 Overall this is a great beer, unfortunately the $1.50/oz price tag will more than likely keep me from burning out on them.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Copper pour, with minimal head very little carbonation. Beautiful aroma of cherry, brown sugar and caramel. Taste is brown sugar, cherry some slight heat. Tasty
Bottle - Cherry, wood, sweet stone fruits and booze. Murky maroon with no head. Sweet and complex. Cherry, pitted fruits, oak and so many things going on I just want to drink more.

Hazy ruby red/brown color with cherry peel floaters suspended. Malty and oaky aroma, caramelized booze, cherries. 

Taste improves significantly as it warms. Peach-cherry blend works well, yet gets overshadowed a bit by the booze character. Floating cherry flesh adds a unique twist. Should age like a champ.

Bottle from St John. Thanks man! Aroma is hot with cherry and peach notes. Flavor surprisingly doesn't carry the same heat, but has fruity notes which offset a malty English barleywine. Palate has medium+ carbonation, which is a nice departure from HotD carb issues. Just an excellent beer! (Pairs well with Eagle Rare bourbon and Twizzlers.)

Bottle, 10/31/2013, thank to quackus42. Pours deep plum brown, fizzy white head fades to an oily surface roiling with small bubbles of carbonation, strange sediment floating around the edge of the glass. Aroma is rich brown sugar and toffee rounded on top with cherry, plum, subtle acetic sour, with vanilla, dark cookie dough, bourbon. Taste is dark toasted caramel, round full maltiness,earthy cherry with touch of acidity, very light peach overtones peak through for nice accent, decent amount of wood and booze in the finish. Thick, chewy body, nice. Complex, delicious, another winner from HotD.

rich plum, thin white ring. Rich plum nose, brown sugar, light fruit sourness, arguable red acetic notes but so pleasant. Flavor burns lightly confirming acetic, but its all dessert, tons of plum and brown sugar, cake like structure with toasted almonds and the right amount of alcohol through the rich end. With warmth it gets too thin and hot, but absolutely fabulous dessert beer yet again from Sprints.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep reddish caramel, very dirty, large cherry chunks floating about, thin sudsy off-white head, sparce lacing. &nbsp Rich malty nose, caramel, alcohol, faint dark or black cherry. &nbsp Some aspects of barrel aging. &nbsp Certainly smells warming! &nbsp Smooth caramel maltiness on the tongue, soft fruitiness, a little warming. &nbsp Low hops, English all the way in its maltiness. &nbsp Not as thick or cloying as I thought it might be for 13%. &nbsp Too easy to drink actually. &nbsp A little vinous, a little cognac like. &nbsp Slight old tobacco comes up at the finish, warming, caramel, malty, light fruitiness. &nbsp Good, clean, interesting and a bit complex, but not as thick or heavy as I would have liked. &nbsp Still a good Barley Wine, and different!

12oz bottle pours an inky, caramel amber with some spitty, white head. Nose has a lot of cherry, Cherry Garcia ice cream, wood, a little anise, some mild acid. Flavor is boozy, fusel alcohol, cherry, medicinal, vanilla, wood pulp, some caramel, some orange pith. Boozy finish. A nice sipper, but needs more time in the bottle to round out.

12oz bottle, thanks GT2. Medium off-white head atop murky copper body. Aroma is moderately sweet, wood, some cherry, vanilla, light sour, roast. Taste is moderately sweet, cherry, some wood, light vinous, vanilla, sour. Sticky full body, minimal carbonation.

Bottle with thanks to Dee! Pour cloudy reddish hazel with a small beige creamy head that slowly dissipates leaving nice lacing. Lovely aroma of bourbon, vanilla, oak tannins, molasses, fig, brown sugar, perhaps a bit of cherry. Flavor is quite sweet, same notes, bourbon prominent, lots of dark fruits and sugars, fairly astringent and a bit of zestiness on the finish. Mouthfeel is medium, a bit hot overall, a couple of loogie-like chunks here and there.

Bottle shared by GT2, thanks GT! Poured a nice very cloudy brown color, some ruby notes, touch of caramel notes, plenty of cherry notes, some almond type flavors. Notes of oak, vanilla, cherries. Nutty, tasty. This is good. So good.

Bottle courtesy of GT2, a huge thanks! Cloudy maroon brown color, white edge head. Aroma of beautiful vanilla, cherry plum, prune. Taste is rich fruity berries, dark fruit, vanilla, plum pudding. Amazing.

Bottle shared by GT2. Pours lightly cloudy brown with a small, fizzy beige head, short retention with no lacing. Aroma is toast, caramel, cookie, and nutty malt with cherries, figs, and dates with earthy hops. Flavor is malt dominant with oak, vanilla, brown sugar, light hops and bitterness, dark fruits and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

12-oz. Pours a murky dark amber with no head or lace. Heavy and still. Bright fruity nose, vinous, boozy, peaches, and plum reduction. Sticky thick body with minimal carb. Fruit, peaches, plums, oak, peat, earth, and dark caramel on the mid palate. Long sticky sweet finish.

12 ounce bottle. I had this at the brewery and now one at home. Pours a deep murky brown and purple color with a small white head. Huge chunks of fruit float to the top. Sweet hot nose of bourbon and fruit. Complex sweet flavor: bourbon, grapes, sweet fruity hops, apricot. The thick particulates are hard to get used to. Hot. Boozy. Good. Cherry and sugary barley wine. Damn good. Odd.

12 oz. bottle, pours an opaque cloudy dark mahogany with a small off-white head and an absurd amount of sediment. Aroma is complex, with notes of cherries, peaches, oak, and treacle toffee. Flavour is very complex, with loads of peaches and cherries, which combine beautifully with the woody oak. Also notes of treacle toffee that linger on the finish. I had to pick out yeast sediments from this - a little repulsive, but the beer itself is exquisite. Very deep and complex. Delicious stuff.

355mL from the release day at HotD. Pours inky purple, thinner pink foam. Big cherry pit chunkies fall out. Nose is heavy B Nektar style black cherry explosion, decadent and near perfect. Taste follows suit ditching the candi sugar and cheesy hop nonsense of Fred and gaining a full on black cherry dessert character. Dense sugar is cut by cherry acid. No peach nonsense flavor whatsoever. Super legit, super walez, big ruby tones, high boost. Possibly the best from HotD.

Draft @ HOTD. POurs a murky, maroon brown color; head soon departs. Layers of dried fruits, a bit of warming alcohol, and some denser caramel and vanilla and light tannins. Full mouthfeel; modest CO2; a nice acidity; quite pleasant to drink overall. Layers of dense dried fruits, caramel, dates, and hints of toasty coconut; a delicious, full-bodied barley wine. Balanced end.

12oz glass at the brewery. Just tapped, so its out of the fridge at a really cold temperature.

A: Bit of a mess off the tap. Looks like blood mixed with mud with some prune juice thrown in. No head, no hint of carbonation.Likely still settling after just being tapped, but this isnt out of the norm for HotD either. 

N: Oak and cherry are the dominant flavors right off the nose. Hints of honey and brown sugar. Slight hints of the peach, but theyre very faint. Leather and tobacco. Dont know if its the chill, but Im not getting a strong nose out of this. Its there, but its taking a number of whiffs to pull out flavor.

T: Sweet cherries and cherry jam spiked with pepppercorns, toasted oak, and hints of caramel.  Marionberries are present, as is some vinous red wine grape. Leathery components, and a very strong resemblance to port with the sweet brandy qualities and cherry flavors. Quite sweet, lots of malt and sugar, but it never breaks my threshold, either.  Rye, I think, is evident.

M: Thick, sticky, and beautiful at hiding the alcohol. This is pretty much the consistency of Fred as one might expect.

O: A decadent treat for those who like port dessert wines. Its far greater than the sum of its parts (Cherry and Peach Fred), and for that it should be commended. Still, I would rate this about the middle of the Hair of the Dog pantheon.

On tap @ HotD. Pours murky almost muddy brown with no head whatsoever. Aroma is big bourbon and peaches.  Somewhat thin mouthfeel and totally flat.  Taste is huge rich earthy oaky malts with notes of peaches, cherries, charred oak, bourbon, and figs.  Super boozy, 13% feels on the lighter end.  I havent had either of the beers they used to make this, but the end result is impressive. If there were some additional carbonation added this could be amazing.

On tap @ the brewpub. Very dark brown. Aroma is nothing short of pure awesomeness! Sweet dark fruits, cherries, crazy fresh pulpy coconut, treacle, vanilla, fig jam... I could drink this for the rest of my life. No hint of the ABV. How I wish I could bring this home.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: I was told this was 13% abv, and that was quite noticeable. When I was leaving, I could feel every piece of Otto running through my veins. Tap at the brewery. Peaches, cherries, added to a barrel-aged Fred? Yes, fucking please! I see that people couldnt taste the peaches all too well? I cant understand that, as this had a nice Fred sweetness to it, that balance well with the deep peach fruit flavor. The cherries or a similar fruitiness that give this whole thing a wonderful twist. I consider Fred to be, borderline, too sweet, but the fruit really adds a nuance that helps mitigate that overly sweet sensation. The barrel elements are really poking through, as I just sit here, and let it warm up. The vanilla, and bourbon really come across quite well. The texture is insanely rich, for beer. Im one of those weather-specific drinkers, as in, I think certain style suit certain seasons more, and Id definitely prefer it to be colder outside, as the heat from the boozy flavor is warming me up. The color is nice, and it has amber, ruby, and somewhat purple hues to it. Overall, Im going crazy over the rich fruit flavors that dominate here. Also, I love how the barrel elements are strikingly prominent. I love this "? From the Wood" menu option. Glad to be in Portland, this weekend.

On tap at HOTD. Colour...cloudy garnet amber with no head. Nose...loads of crushed currants and mashed dates with cherry kirsch red wine soaked oak. Palate...very low CO2, a quick boozy hit then  port soaked raisins and dried Brooks prunes at the front of the palate and bing cherry and cherry bark at the back of  the palate and a lengthy finish that has the fruity tartness of a low sugar jam. I sure hope Sprints bottles this gem!

Draught at HOTD Tasting Room. Fruity aroma: cherries, cocoanut, sour wine. Deep red wine-like color, completely flat. Amazing initial hits of dark fruit, berries, cherries; mid palate is wonderfully balanced. Medium-heavy body. Another winner emerges from the wood wizardry of Alan Sprints. Resembles a friendly, warm wine/fruit liqueur. Great!

On tap at the brewpub - Holy balls did I time my trip to Portland right. Pours deep ruby with no head. Nose is sweet bourbon and caramel, cherry with hints of oak and heat. Taste is fantastic--really smooth blend of black cherry, bourbon, vanilla, mellow oak, and big waves of bready malt. Dont get the peaches, but Im sure theyre in there somewhere. Real smooth and velvety in the mouth, even though its not all that carbonated.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 [Updated Rating; 8/30/12] Had gotten to try this again at the tasting room. This time with added carbonation. It just pushed it over that edge to make it more sublime.  It contained a nice, off-white pinkish head that sat lovely on top of the dark, murky red pour. The added body and carbonation allowed the bourbon and dark fruit flavors to shine and reminded me more of a bourbon cocktail. Nicely done!

[Original Rating; 8/1/12 - 4.1 score]
A blend of barrel aged Cherry and Peach Freds on tap @ HotD...  Poured deep amber, sort of blood red, with no head.  Thin body and mouthfeel, and hardly any carbonation. Not totally negative but I think this couldve benefited from a thicker mouthfeel.  Nose had brown sugar and whiskey barrel tones. The cherries and peaches combined tasted of dessert-like spices similar to nutmeg and cinnamon.  Cherries were overall dominant over the peaches though.  Some vanilla bean which reminded me of cobbler.  Bubblegum sweetness, vanilla, and cotton candy.  Not cloyingly sweet though.  Light and dark fruits, oak and other charred wood tones. Had a big boozy, whiskey finish.  I think this would be a phenomenal Christmas time beer.
